annotation.spannedText: Doubts about vaccines helped fuel Minnesota’s biggest outbreak of measles in decades, and attracted determined vaccine skeptics eager to exploit fear

classMention.mentionClass: Doubts about vaccines helped fuel Minnesota’s biggest outbreak of measles in decades, and attracted determined vaccine skeptics eager to exploit fear

annotation.spannedText: But the outbreak has not only caught people’s attention; it has helped demonstrate that anti-vaccine activists are wrong

classMention.mentionClass: But the outbreak has not only caught people’s attention; it has helped demonstrate that anti-vaccine activists are wrong

annotation.spannedText: At least 48 people have been infected, nearly all of them children, and 11 kids are in the hospital with pneumonia and other dangerous complications

classMention.mentionClass: At least 48 people have been infected, nearly all of them children, and 11 kids are in the hospital with pneumonia and other dangerous complications

annotation.spannedText: The doubts and fears created a “natural experiment” in which vaccination rates plummeted, and disease broke out

classMention.mentionClass: The doubts and fears created a “natural experiment” in which vaccination rates plummeted, and disease broke out

annotation.spannedText: David Johnson, program manager with the Hennepin County Health Department

classMention.mentionClass: David Johnson, program manager with the Hennepin County Health Department

annotation.spannedText: “What we have now is a community that was really influenced by these anti-vaccine groups. And they’ve performed a natural experiment: to forgo the measles vaccine based on this propaganda,”

classMention.mentionClass: “What we have now is a community that was really influenced by these anti-vaccine groups. And they’ve performed a natural experiment: to forgo the measles vaccine based on this propaganda,”

annotation.spannedText: Somali immigrants have been the hardest hit by the outbreak

classMention.mentionClass: Somali immigrants have been the hardest hit by the outbreak

annotation.spannedText: “We’ve seen that the vaccine rates in the community that’s being affected right now were once about the same or even a little higher than our average. They’ve dropped to about half of that,” ... “And unfortunately now we are seeing the result. Measles is spreading rapidly in the community and 11 children are hospitalized. And at the same time there is no evidence of any corresponding drop in autism in the community.”

classMention.mentionClass: “We’ve seen that the vaccine rates in the community that’s being affected right now were once about the same or even a little higher than our average. They’ve dropped to about half of that,” ... “And unfortunately now we are seeing the result. Measles is spreading rapidly in the community and 11 children are hospitalized. And at the same time there is no evidence of any corresponding drop in autism in the community.”

annotation.spannedText: “The last project we were involved in we found that one in 32 Somali individuals have been diagnosed with autism from the severe end to mild,” ... “It is being highlighted in the community. There is fear.”

classMention.mentionClass: “The last project we were involved in we found that one in 32 Somali individuals have been diagnosed with autism from the severe end to mild,” ... “It is being highlighted in the community. There is fear.”

annotation.spannedText: Mohamud Noor, Director of the Confederation of Somali Community in Minneapolis

classMention.mentionClass: Mohamud Noor, Director of the Confederation of Somali Community in Minneapolis

annotation.spannedText: Noor, himself the father of four young kids 10 and younger,

classMention.mentionClass: Noor, himself the father of four young kids 10 and younger,

annotation.spannedText: he even considered delaying their vaccinations

classMention.mentionClass: he even considered delaying their vaccinations

annotation.spannedText: why not wait a little bit?

classMention.mentionClass: why not wait a little bit?

annotation.spannedText: “I thought, why not wait a little bit?” ... “That’s someone who is as well informed as I. That message has been highly escalated and many people have been talking about it.”

classMention.mentionClass: “I thought, why not wait a little bit?” ... “That’s someone who is as well informed as I. That message has been highly escalated and many people have been talking about it.”

annotation.spannedText: to do organizing within the community that’s affected here

classMention.mentionClass: to do organizing within the community that’s affected here

annotation.spannedText: “There has been ongoing contact between outside groups who have come in and wanted to do organizing within the community that’s affected here,” ... “And I think that’s really unfortunate because some of the anti-vaccine propaganda is largely to blame for what’s going on in our community.”

classMention.mentionClass: “There has been ongoing contact between outside groups who have come in and wanted to do organizing within the community that’s affected here,” ... “And I think that’s really unfortunate because some of the anti-vaccine propaganda is largely to blame for what’s going on in our community.”

annotation.spannedText: the anti-vaccine activists figured out they could not reach the approximately 25,000 members of Somali community by internet alone

annotation.spannedText: that’s how the public health officials will also have to work

annotation.spannedText: “We are an oral society. We spread the information neighbor to neighbor. It is more of a communal discussion that spreads better than the internet,”

annotation.spannedText: there is no link at all between vaccination and autism

annotation.spannedText: parents to be able to choose

classMention.mentionClass: parents to be able to choose

annotation.spannedText: they don't doubt all vaccines but simply want parents to be able to choose and want vaccines to be made safer

annotation.spannedText: the vaccine schedule has been carefully studied

classMention.mentionClass: the vaccine schedule has been carefully studied

annotation.spannedText: that children are vaccinated at the right times to keep them safe

annotation.spannedText: “These groups continue to fabricate and promote alternative facts that have no bearing on reality,” ... “They've preyed on parents' concerns about the health of their children and they've provided them false hope that avoiding the measles vaccine will somehow prevent autism, when in fact not vaccinating only serves to increase the risk of a child getting a disease and then spreading it to others.”

annotation.spannedText: “We do have something we didn’t have a few months ago in our community and that’s people’s full and undivided attention,” ... “I think that’s something that we are hoping to be able to use in order to help promote the messaging.”

annotation.spannedText: “We tell the community that we know what causes measles,” ... “Unfortunately, we don’t know what causes autism.”
